intro: Pecluma perpinnata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved pecluma, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a rough texture with prominent veins. The flowers are usually yellow or greenish-yellow, with five petals and numerous stamens, and it produces small, woody pods containing seeds.
